metadata.title: CVE-2016-0728 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
The join_session_keyring function in security/keys/process_keys.c in theLinux kernel before 4.4.1 mishandles object references in a certain errorcase, which allows local users to gain privileges or cause a denial ofservice (integer overflow and use-after-free) via crafted keyctl commands.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0728` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.3.0-7-generic - 4.3.0-7.18
linux-image-4.3.0-7-generic-lpae - 4.3.0-7.18
linux-image-4.3.0-7-lowlatency - 4.3.0-7.18
linux-image-4.3.0-7-powerpc-e500mc - 4.3.0-7.18
linux-image-4.3.0-7-powerpc-smp - 4.3.0-7.18
linux-image-4.3.0-7-powerpc64-emb - 4.3.0-7.18
linux-image-4.3.0-7-powerpc64-smp - 4.3.0-7.18
linux-image-extra-4.3.0-7-generic - 4.3.0-7.18
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.0-7.18').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.4').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
